metadata.title: CVE-2021-47466 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mm,slub: fix potential memoryleak in kmem_cache_open() In error path, therandom_seq of slub cache might be leaked. Fix this by using__kmem_cache_release() to release all the relevant resources.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1061-aws - 5.4.0-1061.64~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1065-azure - 5.4.0-1065.68~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1059-gcp - 5.4.0-1059.63~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1059-oracle - 5.4.0-1059.63~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1048-raspi - 5.4.0-1048.53~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
